issue.title: move stateful set filter to per route filter

labels.name: size/L
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

labels.name: release-notes-none
labels.description: Indicates a PR that does not require release notes.

issue.body:
This PR 
- Moves the Statefulsession filter to per route instead of per virtual host
- Decides based on route destination i.e. if the route destination service has labels attached this filter will be added. Without this, the stateful session filter wont be generated for virtual hosts that are generated based on virtual service hosts.
- Added tests to cover these flows

- [ ] Ambient
- [ ] Configuration Infrastructure
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Dual Stack
- [ ] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Policies and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure

comment.body: @costinm retained the old behaviour for BC and added comments. PTAL

issue.title: After istio version upgrade the ".items[N].spec.tag" for istioOperator is not changed to the newer version
issue.body:
### Is this the right place to submit this?

- [X] This is not a security vulnerability or a crashing bug
- [X] This is not a question about how to use Istio

### Bug Description

Im using istioctl to install / upgrade the istio in my clusters hosted in OCI. The upgrade from 1.15.1 to 1.16.0 happened without any errors, but when I checked the ".items[0].spec.tag" for istioOperator, it still points to 1.15.1 
This behavior seems to be inconsistent as I see some of my other clusters have the tab value correctly pointing to 1.16.0
And I see all the proxies, control-plane, and data-plane are showing as 1.16.0 .
What is the significance of ".items[0].spec.tag" and how is it being used? I thought this was from where the istio operator picks up the value of the image tag to be used.
`
kubectl get IstioOperator -n istio-system -o jsonpath='{.items[0].spec.tag}'
1.15.1
`




### Version

```Text
istioctl version
client version: 1.16.0
control plane version: 1.16
data plane version: 1.16-dev (37 proxies)
```


### Additional Information

_No response_

### Affected product area

- [ ] Ambient
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Dual Stack
- [X] Installation
- [ ] Networking
- [ ] Performance and Scalability
- [ ] Extensions and Telemetry
- [ ] Security
- [ ] Test and Release
- [ ] User Experience
- [ ] Developer Infrastructure
- [X] Upgrade
- [ ] Multi Cluster
- [ ] Virtual Machine
- [ ] Control Plane Revisions

issue.title: uninstall: fix no confirmation when istiod cannot be connected

labels.name: size/XS
labels.description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

issue.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Currently, when istiod cannot be connected, the components will be uninstalled without any confirmation. Not sure if the behavior - skipping confirmation when no proxy info was obtained - was intentional, however I think it doesn't mean there's no proxy so it's better to have a confirmation like other situations do.

pull_request.title: Implement support for configuring the connection pool of inbound clusters via the Sidecar API
pull_request.body:
**Please provide a description of this PR:**
Implements support for server-side connection pool configuration via the Sidecar API, based on the [API change in this PR](https://github.com/istio/api/pull/2961).

Salient things here is how this interacts with DestinationRule for configuring inbound clusters. This PR implements the following precedence for picking connection pool config (highest to lowest):
1) per-port ConnectionPool from the Sidecar
2) top-level InboundConnectionPool from the Sidecar
3) per-port TrafficPolicy.ConnectionPool from the DestinationRule
4) top-level TrafficPolicy.ConnectionPool from the DestinationRule.
(3 and 4 are unchanged from before this PR.)

This PR does not change how client-side connection pools are configured (which remains DestinationRule only).




TODO before this moves from draft to real PR:
- [x] update go.mod/go.sum to point to istio/istio after https://github.com/istio/api/pull/2961 is merged
- [x] remove the `SidecarPort` changes after PR (TODO find link) is merged fixing it
- [x] add release notes for this change
- [ ] add integration tests (there seem to be a lack of integration tests that use `Sidecar`?)
